It just struck me that container queries are amazing for typesetting on the web. You could easily do something like...

```css
.container { container-type: inline-size; }

p {
font-size: clamp(1rem, 2.5cqw, 2rem);
line-height: clamp(1.35rem, 3.5cqw, 1.9rem);
}

```

Venture capital-backed startups used to IPO but now they're being acquired.

My new paper with B. Pellegrino documents this secular shift and shows that serial acquirers of startups have become particularly insulated from product market competition.

We further show that these trends are accompanied by an increase in the opportunity cost of going public.

These facts are consistent with the hypothesis that startup acquisitions have contributed to rising oligopoly power.

https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=4322834

In this nice analysis from Super-Kamiokande we use 20+ years of data to set limits on the interactions of very light dark matter coming from the the galactic center.

It's a technically interesting analysis as we use fast moving protons that make Cherenkov light to find events and determine their direction (harder than our typical analyses that use electrons and muons).

The analysis was led by Linyan Wan at Boston Univ.

title: Dr. Michael Miller Math Class Hints and Tips | UCLA Extension | Chris Aldrich

last_post.content:
Quantum mechanics anyone? Dozens have been disappointed by UCLA’s administration ineptly standing in the way of Dr. Mike Miller being able to offer his perennial Winter UCLA math class (Ring Theory this quarter), so a few friends and I are putting our informal math and physics group back together.

We’re mounting a study group on quantum mechanics based on Peter Woit‘s Introduction to Quantum Mechanics course from 2022. We’ll be using his textbook Quantum Theory, Groups and Representations:An Introduction (free, downloadable .pdf) and his lectures from YouTube.

Shortly, we’ll arrange a schedule and some zoom video calls to discuss the material. If you’d like to join us, send me your email or leave a comment so we can arrange meetings (likely via Zoom or similar video conferencing).

Our goal is to be informal, have some fun, but learn something along the way. The suggested mathematical background is some multi-variable calculus and linear algebra. Many of us already have some background in Lie groups, algebras, and representation theory and can hopefully provide some help for those who are interested in expanding their math and physics backgrounds.

Everyone is welcome! 

#group-theory #lie-groups #peter-woit #physics #quantum-mechanics #representation-theory

https://boffosocko.com/2023/01/26/quantum-mechanics-study-group-for-peter-woit/

<>

test

</h1>

)

I am exploring what you can get out of the new NZ Ministry of Health dashboard, https://minhealthnz2.shinyapps.io/covid19/ , and there is pretty clear evidence of a sustained drop in the case fatality rate among 80 years and up in September.
